basics.name: Geri Rosenberg
basics.label: GIS Analyst
basics.summary: I'm a runner, cyclist, and long-distance backpacker with a passion for smart growth and protecting public lands

education.area: Advanced GIS and Web Map Programming

highlights: Deputy project manager for $1M FTA contract; directed team through complex Federal security process and trained colleagues in expansive database access, organization, and queries
Aggregated economic data from 41 transit agencies in Virginia, accounting for nearly 175M annual ridership, $575M+ in payroll, and $480M+ in capital spending
Collected, segmented, and analyzed data for state DOT performance measures (with focus on road safety); led QA/QC and developed static visualizations and maps for reports
Deputy project manager for $2M FTA transit-oriented development technical assistance contract; compiled quarterly financial and descriptive reports and led call agendas
Surveyed real estate/land use and developed maps for 20+ technical assistance recipients, focused in transit-oriented development and downtown redevelopment
Built from scratch a two-part study tour showcasing downtown redevelopment and talent attraction innovation, in Denver and Greenville, South Carolina
Researched for and co-authored rural affordable housing toolkit

Mobilized public education campaign for the planned Bus Rapid Transit System (BRT) in Montgomery County, MD & recruited coalition of local supporters; developed best practices BRT design guide for stakeholders & community

publications.name: Careless Decay: Dental Deserts in the United States
publications.summary: Interactive story map awarded first place in NACIS competition

publications.name: How the D.C. Region Gets to Work

awards.title: First Place, Group Student Dynamic Map Competition
Colorado Trail Thru-Hiker
awards.awarder: Solo-backpacked 485 miles between Denver and Durango in 24 days
